title: Peanut Butter Bars Recipe
description: These peanut butter bars are rich, creamy, and taste just like peanut butter cups. Made with just 5 ingredients, these no-bake bars are easy to make.

Recipes Peanut Butter Bars 4.6 (3,104) 2,353 Reviews 230 Photos These peanut butter bars taste just like peanut butter cups. Submitted by Nancy Updated on August 21, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 230 230 230 230 Prep Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 25 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 bars Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 2 cups graham cracker crumbs 2 cups confectioners' sugar 1 cup butter or margarine, melted 1 cup peanut butter 1 ½ cups semisweet chocolate chips 4 tablespoons peanut butter Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix together graham cracker crumbs, confectioners' sugar, butter or margarine, and 1 cup peanut butter in a medium bowl until well-blended. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Press evenly into the bottom of an ungreased 9x13-inch pan. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Place chocolate chips and 4 tablespoons peanut butter in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high, stirring every 15 seconds, until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Spread mixture over crust. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before cutting into 12 squares. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Editor's Note: This recipe appears as "No-Bake Spicy Peanut Butter Squares" in Allrecipes Magazine and was modified to include Sriracha for an expected pop of spice. I Made It Print 5,080 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 532 Calories 37g Fat 49g Carbs 9g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 12 Calories 532 % Daily Value * Total Fat 37g 47% Saturated Fat 17g 83% Cholesterol 41mg 14% Sodium 320mg 14% Total Carbohydrate 49g 18% Dietary Fiber 3g 11% Total Sugars 38g Protein 9g 18% Calcium 26mg 2% Iron 2mg 9% Potassium 275mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Peanut Butter Bars 01 of 230 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 230 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02/14/2025 This recipe is amazing! I do the recipe as written but put them in mini muffin tins, lined with mini liners to make like a Reese’s peanut butter cup. Cut the recipe in half and it made 24 cups and so easy to come out with the liners. I also sprinkle some Maldon finishing salt at the end before refrigerating. My family loves them! 03 of 230 Photo by  somerset 08/02/2024 Very easy to make! I’d make it with my grandkids for an after school math activity. Make it challenging and divide the recipe in half. Make memories! 04 of 230 Photo by  ArtsyFries5084 03/18/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Worth the effort I think this recipe is really good. I made it and I’m 11 it’s super easy and really fun to do. I also really like what Nessa said about cooling the base before adding the chocolate top. I think that that is a good strategy I guess I’m probably going to try it that way next. But other than that I think that the no-bake peanut butter bars are a must to all family’s they take a while but they are worth the wait. 05 of 230 Photo by  BEAUTIFULB 05/22/2023 Delicious! I used two sleeves of graham crackers, put them in a large zip-loc bag, and crushed them with a rolling pin. The texture was perfect! I always feel proud bringing these to a party! 06 of 230 Photo by  ClassyBass6741 08/07/2022 Great recipe and easy to follow directions! I also made the creamy frosting to go with it. 07 of 230 Photo by  Christine Saunders Namoski 07/27/2022 08 of 230 Photo by  MatureTofu6435 06/24/2022 I had to improvise. I’m a head cook at a nursing home and this was on the menu and I’ve never made it before. So instead of chocolate chips I used Hershey chocolate syrup and mixed it with PB it came out awesome. It wasn’t too sweet for the elderly and I look forward to tweak it the recipe for next time thank you ! 09 of 230 Photo by  LilacBeef6806 05/15/2022 Cheaper than buying peanut butter cups, and you know what’s in it! I love this recipe. Same as the one my mom made when I was little. I’ll probably half the batch next time, it makes a lot of bars. :) Delicious! 10 of 230 Photo by  Eat 04/30/2022 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Peanut Butter Rice Krispie Treats 128 Ratings Peanut Butter Pie Bars 4 Ratings Michelle's Peanut Butter Marbled Brownies 419 Ratings Magic Peanut Butter Middles 824 Ratings Chocolate Peanut Butter Balls 249 Ratings Peanut Butter Cup Cookies 4,543 Ratings Oatmeal Peanut Butter Cookies III 1,406 Ratings T. T.'s Cookies 91 Ratings Peanut Butter Cup Brownies 152 Ratings Peanut Butter and Oat Brownies 28 Ratings The Whole Jar of Peanut Butter Cookies 882 Ratings 4-Ingredient Keto Peanut Butter Cookies 145 Ratings Oatmeal Peanut Butter Cookies 3,153 Ratings Special Edition Peanut Butter Cookies 8 Ratings Yummy Peanut Butter Cookies 122 Ratings Eggless Peanut Butter Cookies 232 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
